name: Helvetica;;;*;;Apple Crumble
instructions: Spice bag (including cinnamon, star anise, cloves, fennel seeds, peppercorn)
for the crumble
400gr plain flour
350gr butter
300gr demerara sugar
2 tbsp ginger powder
baker 15 min at 180*

name: Helvetica-Bold;Helvetica;;;;*;;;Bread and butter pudding (Byatt style)
instructions: Bring the double cream to a simmer. Mix everything else until dissolved completely. Slowly add the hot cream. Put to the side for now.
Cut up Brioche or hot cross bun or any bread like croissant and slice into thing slices. If the crust is too crunchy, cut it off before.

Take your oven mould, and butter it completely so it doesnt stick. Take your thinly sliced brioche bread and dip it in the custard, then fill the oven mould with it and leave no open spots. Add some extra custard after each layer and some raisins and keep layering until the mould is filled.
Now put in a tray on an oven cloth, add water until half the mould is covered. Cover the mould with baking paper and foil and cook in the oven at 185°c for 1 hour. Check if its cooked.
Once its cooked, place a heavy tray on it with weight and put in the fridge over night. The next day, slice portions out and serve hot with custard. Add sugar on top and caramelise.
filename: Bread and butter pudding byatt style.rtf

name: Helvetica-Bold;Helvetica;;;*;;Brine
instructions: Mix everything in a big pot and bring to a boil. Let completely cool, before using as a brine.

name: Helvetica-Bold;Helvetica;;;*;;Brownie:
instructions: Mix flour, coco powder and salt. Mix melted butter with sugar, slowly add beaten eggs till fully incorporated. Add a splash of vanilla extract. Mix in chocolate palettes.
Fill into gastro lined with parchment paper and bake at 175°c for 30-40 minutes. Let set fully in the fridge before cutting into portions.

name: Helvetica;;;*;;Buffalo chicken;
instructions: Butterfly chicken breast (about 150g each, fillets taken off)
For the flour;
350g Plain flour
250g Corn flour
2tbsp Paprika
2tbsp Garlic
1tbsp table salt
Deep fry for at least 5 min

name: Buffalo Sauce
instructions: Melt the butter, add Franks Sauce and then blitz together.

name: Helvetica;;;*;;CAULIFLOWER CHEESE
ingredients: 4 Culiflower heads cut into small florets

name: Helvetica-Bold;Helvetica;;;*;;Cauliflower Gratin
instructions: Melt the butter in a pot. Add Onions and cook colourless till tender. Meanwhile slowly heat up the Milk in a different pot, add all spices in a spice bag already and put into the milk.
Once the onions are cooked, add the flour and cook it out for 4-5 minutes on medium low heat.
Add the hot Milk in batches to the flour, stir till homogenous. Once all incorporated, bring to a simmer and take off the heat.
Add cheese, mustard, MSG and mix till fully incorporated. Mix with the cauliflower and season to taste.
On Sunday, fill side dishes with cauliflower gratin mix, add cheddar and parmesan on top.

name: Helvetica-Bold;Helvetica;;;*;;Cesar Dressing
instructions: Put the garlic in a pot and add cold water. Bring to a boil and discard water. Repeat 2 more times. Now put everything in a blender except the oil and blend until pasty. Now slowly add the oil like making a mayonnaise. Season to taste and put in the fridge.

name: Helvetica;;;*;;CHOCOLATE DELICE
instructions: Then add to egg and sugar mixture slowly, cook off on low heat til thickens by 30%
700g 70% chocolate - melt in the hot custard
300g dbl cream semi wipped -  fold in the chocolate custard
For the praline base;
300g Hazelnuts
225g Caster sugar
150ml H2O
Cook off sugar and water, once happy with the colour, add toasted shelled hazelnut and poor on a flat tray.
Once completely cold, blitz with 1 packet of digestive biscuit.

name: Helvetica-Bold;Helvetica;;;*;;Creme Brûlée (makes 13 portions)
instructions: Bring Cream to just a simmer and take off heat. Meanwhile, beat egg yolks and sugar together in a bowl, making sure not to incorporate too much air. Use a spatula to mix.
Now add the hot cream slowly to the egg mix while mixing constantly. Pass through a sieve.
Weigh out 180g per portion. But the dishes on a tray lined with a kitchen towel and fill the tray with hot water. Put in the oven.
Cook at 120°c for about 15-25 minutes on fan 3! Check with wobble test. Put in the fridge and let cool for at least 4 hours.

name: HelveticaNeue-Bold;HelveticaNeue;;;;*;;;Crumble
instructions: Mix everything together. Crumble everything on top of an oven tray and bake at 185°c for about 10 minutes. Let cool completely.

name: Helvetica-Bold;Helvetica;;;*;;Curry sauce
instructions: Slice Onion and Carrots thinly. Sweat onion and carrots in butter until soft. Meanwhile heat up the veg stock together with the apple juice.

Once the vegetables are soft, add the flour, curry powder and white pepper and cook out the flour for a few minutes. Slowly add the veg stock until its thickened and combined. Blend till smooth and season to taste.

name: Helvetica-Bold;Helvetica;;;*;;Custard
instructions: Bring the cream and milk with the vanilla just to a simmer. Take off the heat. Mix sugar and egg yolk with a spatula until smooth and the sugar is dissolved. Try not to incorporate too much air into the mix.

Now slowly add the hot cream while constantly mixing. Once its all mixed, strain through a chinois and place in theodora. Use thicken program until you reached the desired consistency. Let cool in the fridge.

name: Helvetica;;;*;;Fish Pie
instructions: Pour milk and cream into a medium pan, bring to simmer and add the fish and prawns, poach in the simmering milk for about 2 minutes.
drain the fish and reserve the poaching liquid.
Wipe the pan, add the butter, bring to bubble, then stir in the flour, reduce the heat and cook for 8 minutes.
Add half of the reserved liquid, bring back to a simmer, whisking continuously to prevent any lumps.
Add the remaining liquid and cook until thick and smooth. Add the capers, parsley, chives, mustard and salt and mix well.
Returne the drained fish to the pan a gently fold in the sauce.
For the topping

Put the potatoes in a pan and add enough salted water to cover them. Bring to boil, then reduce the heat and simmer untill the potatoes are very tender. Drain the water, add the milk, double cream and butter to the pan and mash together with the potatoes until smooth.
Add the yolks with the sat, mix well until incorporate.
Cook the finished pie at 180* for about 20 min

name: Helvetica;;;*;;Fish Sauce Caramel (Thai)
instructions: Put fish sauce, water and sugar into a stock pot, reduce by half over low heat.
once happy with the consistency take off the heat add the sherry vinegar and stir in.

name: Helvetica-Bold;Helvetica;;;*;;Gravy
instructions: Roast the bones in the oven, 45-50 minutes at 180°c.

Meanwhile, cut the mire poix in walnut sized pieces and roast in a wide pot. Stir constantly on medium high heat till nicely coloured. About 25 minutes. Add tomato paste and keep roasting till nicely browned, making sure to not burn the bottom of the pan.
Deglaze the pot with red wine. Scrap the pot bottom clean with a spatula. Reduce all the way down to a glaze. Add water.

Once the bones are roasted, add everything to a big pot. Add hot water to the oven trays and scrap out everything and add to the pot as well. Cover with chicken stock, and ice water and slowly bring to a boil. Keep degreasing and taking of building foam. Just simmer all day. Take off the heat and pass through a cheese cloth. Keep the bones. Refrigerate the stock.
The next day. Take the bones, add water and simmer for another 3-4 hours. Pass through a cheesecloth and refrigerate.
The next day. Take the fat off the top of the stock. Put the stock on the stove and reduce to desired consistency and flavour. Refrigerate.

name: Gyoza Dipping sauce
ingredients: Mix all together and store in fridge

name: Helvetica-Bold;Helvetica;;;*;;Toffee Sauce
instructions: Melt Sugar slightly with salt and room temperature butter until dissolved. Once melted, take out of the heat and add double cream while whisking constantly.

name: Helvetica;;;*;;NAM FRIED CHICKEN
ingredients: For breading, use 70% plain flour 30% corn flour
instructions: pre fry for 3 min at 175  and finish in the oven for about 5 min

name: Helvetica;;;*;;NAM FRIED CHICKEN
ingredients: For breading, use 70% plain flour 30% corn flour
instructions: pre fry for 3 min at 175  and finish in the oven for about 5 min

name: Arial-BoldMT;ArialMT;HelveticaNeue;;;;;;;;;*;;;;;;;;Korean BBQ Sauce
instructions: Put everything together in a pot. Bring to a boil. After blend till smooth.

name: Helvetica-Bold;Helvetica;;;;*;;;Mac and Cheese
instructions: Slowly heat up the Milk. In a pot, melt the butter and sweat the onions thinly sliced until soft.
Once soft, add the flour and the spices and cook the flour for a few minutes. Slowly add the milk until you have a smooth béchamel sauce.
Take off the heat, add all cheeses and dijon mustard and mix until everything is melted and smooth. Check for seasoning.

name: Helvetica;;;*;;Mango Salsa
ingredients: 1 large ripe Mango( peeled and cut into 1cm dice)
20g coriander leaves and stalks roughly chopped

name: Helvetica;;;;*;;;MASHED POTATOES
instructions: Butter after the potatoes are cooked the butter have to be the same weight as the potatoes
Dont boil the potatoes. Leave always at simmer otherwise they break down and they loose all the amid and the mash will be like glue.
Once you have them soft, peel from hot using a towel and weight and add the same amount of butter which have to be cold, add and mix well to incorporate it.
Add salt to taste.

name: Helvetica-Bold;Helvetica;;;;*;;;Swiss Meringue
ingredients: 2 egg white (make sure there is ZERO egg yolk in there)
instructions: Mix egg white and sugar. Put on a double boiler and heat up the mixture while you stir until about 62*c.
Take off the heat, whip with a stand mixer on low to medium speed or a lot of elbow grease until cool.
Spread on a tray or pipe and dry overnight at 50*c or in an Excalibur.

name: Helvetica;;;*;;MISO AIOLI
instructions: blitz with hand blender acqua faba and garlic for seconds, then slowly start pouring olive oil, till emulsified.
combine miso paste with 1 tbsp of watering the vinegar till smooth, then add to the aioli and blend again to combine together.

name: Helvetica;;;*;;NUT ROAST
ingredients: Start by prepping all the components,
instructions: Boill Lentils in salted water till mushy about 1 hour
Roast the Butternut Squash with Thyme, Sage & Garlic, salt pepper and olive oil, at 180* x about 30 min ( till soft, then scoop flash out of the skin)
Boill Grains in slightly salted water, about 15 to 20 min.
Chop the smoked almonds.
Mix all ingredients together, season to taste and then transfer into a double sides parchment lined mould , fill up until 3/4 of the mould.
Bake at 180* x 45 minutes.
Cool down overnight and slice 200gr x portion

name: Helvetica-Bold;Helvetica;;;;*;;;Onion Rings
ingredients: 6 italian white Onion, peeled and cut in thick slices and pulled into rings
instructions: Marinade the onion rings in the buttermilk mix for a minimum of 4 hours.
To bread the onions, only use plain flour and panko. You need to double bread the onion rings.

name: Helvetica;;;*;;Piccalilly
ingredients: 1 Fennel bulb ( chopped into 2 cm cubes)
200g green beans ( cut into small batons)
Put cubed vegetables in a large bowl.
instructions: Heat 3 lt of water with 300g salt, whisk until salt dissolve. Poor the hot salted water over the veg and leave to salt for 4 hours.
After 4 hours, drain and rinse in cold water. Leave to drain well.
Meanwhile, make the piccalilly mixture, put all ingridients in a large sauce pan and whisk slowly, cook over low heat until thickened.
Add the drained vegetables to the mixture and mix well.

name: TimesNewRomanPS-BoldMT;TimesNewRomanPSMT;;;*;;Pork Belly Braise
instructions: cook 3hrs on 175*, remove the bones and press for 1 night in the fridge.
Dry the skin at 150* for 1h and leave to cool properly before cutting.

name: Red onion Chutney
instructions: spice bag; (3 star anise,1 cinnamon, 2 bay leaves 4 cloves)
Caramelise the onion in the pan till they are sweet, then add in the sugar and vinegar, season to taste.

name: Helvetica;;;*;;ROAT PORK BELLY
ingredients: 1 Bonless Skin on Pork belly (about 5 kg)
instructions: Start by browning the diced onion in cooking oil, caramelised and soft add in the apples and sage and cook off till soft, season with salt and pepper to taste.
ROLL
Put the stuffing in the meat side of the belly and roll it (nipples to be left outside. tight the roll with 8 to max 10 string pieces.
Cut the roll in half
STEAM
Set the oven on 100* full steam, once heated transfer the pork bellys roll on oven rack and steam for 3 hours.
COOL- DRY
Once cooled, transfer the rolls in the walking fridge, uncovered and as close to the fan possible, (on the oven rack) and leave over night.
OVEN - DRY

Set oven temp to 120*, place rolls in the oven and dry for 1 hour, make sure juices dont fall on the skin, that will stop the crisping process.  Also be careful that the skin dont get too dark b y drying.
Once out of the oven sprinkle table salt and let cool down.
Let dry overnight in the walking fridge ( as close as possible to the fan)
ROAST
Before service, sprinkle more table salt over the skin, roast for 30 minutes at 180* and then 15 minutes at 220* (MAKE SURE SKIN DOESNT BURN) YOU ARE LOOKING FOR A POP COARN EFFECT.
Let cool and slice

name: Helvetica;;;;;*;;;;LAMB SHANK SHEPHERDS PIE
instructions: Give to the lamb shanks a nice and gold colour pan frying them.
Cut the carrots onion and celery and roast them in the oven with oil, black peppercorns and bay leafes.
Once the veggie reach the nicest colour please deglaze them with white wine and cook until the alcohol is evaporated.
Put all together into a gastro and braise them not covering the shanks as the result will be boiled instead.
Plating the lamb:
Once the lamb are cooked, pull them from hot and be careful they might be some bones so please pay attention when do this step.
Cut the carrots and leeks at brunoise and set them aside.
In a pan fry the carrots until nice and gold and then add the leeks and nduja.
Let melt the nduja and take out from the heat.
Mix the veggie with the lamb shank and plate them adding a bit of lamb jus or veal jus.
The portion of this mix is around 170/180g each plate.
Once you plate and everything is set, pipe the mush potatoes on top and store in the fridge.

name: HelveticaNeue-Bold;HelveticaNeue;;;;*;;;**{disc};;;*{disc};;;*Stanley´s hot chicken
instructions: Prep chicken thighs and salt brine for 2 hours (see brine recipe). Leave in Buttermilk dip for frying.
Buttermilk Dip:
-	475ml Buttermilk
-	30ml Hot Sauce
-	30ml Pickle Juice
Flour Dredge: (6x for 10kg chicken)
450g Plain flour
450g Corn flour
16g Table salt
22g Garlic powder
40g cayenne
16g smoked paprika
Coat the chicken in the flour, make sure all wet spots are covered and dry. Fry for 4-5 minutes. Leave to cool

name: Helvetica;;;*;;Beef Stilton & Onion Pie
ingredients: 1 egg yolk beaten with 1tsp of water
600g beef ( chuck or steak, cut 4cm thick)
4 spanish onion (peeled and halved, but with roots on)
instructions: To prepare the filling, put the beef in a roasting tray, dust with the floured toss the beef until all the flour has been absorbed by the meat. Add20 ml of the veg olio the tray and toss well tilll the meat is evenly coated. Put the tray in the oven at 220* and cook for 20 min till browned and liquid evaporated.
While the beef is roasting, cut each onion half into 6 wedges. Put a large frying pan over medium heat, add the remaining 20ml of veg oiled warm up for 1 minute.

Add the onions to the pan and cook, stirring frequently with a wooden spoon until brown. Add the mushrooms to the pan with half of the salt, and continue to cook fort about 4/5 minutes. Next add the wine, the herbs and bring to simmer.

After the beef is been roasting for 20 minutes check if nicely browned. Once ready tip in the tray, onion, mushrooms, herbs and wine. top up with the beef stock, continue to cook for 10 minutes, at 240* then reduce to 180 for 1hour and 45 min.

Once the beef falls a part, strain the liquid and toss it into a pot on medium heat, reduce until the liquid coats the back of a spoon. cool down then add the meat mixture, the crumbled stilton and voila.

name: Helvetica;;;*;;Suet Pastry
instructions: Grate the frozen butter into a bowl and put back in the freezer until needed.
Sift the flour into another bowl, whilst mixing slowly add; grated butter, suet, salt and thyme, mix for about 2 minutes, then slowly add in the cold water until the dough just comes together.
Once happy with the consistency, flatten the dough slighytly, wrap in cling film and refrigerate for at least 30 min before using.
Keep for up to 3 days  in the fridge, or 1 month in the freezer.

name: Helvetica-Bold;Helvetica;;;*;;Sunday Carrots:
instructions: Cut Carrots in the desired shape. Melt the butter in a large big pot. Add the cinnamon and Star Anise to release the aroma. Add carrots and slightly roast off.
Deglaze with white wine, add stock till the carrots are just covered in enough liquid. Add a cartouche and cook until just tender.
Colour the carrots in a hot pan for service, add a bit of cooking liquid and finish with butter. Garnish with chives.

name: HelveticaNeue;;;;*;;;COD ROE EMULTION:
ingredients: 2or 3 lemon juice depend on the size
instructions: Remove the eggs from their bag, than start to blend them in the ROBOCUPE (please do not use vitamix), once the eggs are smooth start to add drop by drop the oil as you are doing a mayonnaise but slightly more gently, the oil will take longer than a normal mayo to absorb, if too much is added the mix WILL NOT emulsify.

You will notice that the mix will start to act like a mayo, but becoming super thick straight away, in this moment you need to add some of the lemon juice  to loosen up than add again oil to thicken it up again. Once lemon juice is done start doing the same with the water (It may not need it all)
Once done store in the piping bags and let rest in the fridge for 1/2 hours before use as it will be warm.

name: Helvetica-Bold;Helvetica;;;*;;Triple Cooked Chips
instructions: Cut potatoes and wash the starch off in cold water till the water runs clear. Put the chips into steaming trays. Dont overcrowd the trays! Steam in the oven for about 8 minutes. Leave in the trays and refrigerate overnight.
2nd Cook:
Heat oil to 140°c. Fry the chips for about 5 minutes in the oil. Refrigerate till completely cold.
3rd Cook: (for Service)
Fry at 190°c till nice golden brown, crispy and delicious. Season with Salt.

name: Helvetica;;;*;;Vegetable Curry
ingredients: 2 Sweet potatoes ( peeled, diced and blunched )

name: Helvetica-Bold;Helvetica;;;*;;Veggie Masala
ingredients: Dry fry all spices together and set aside.
1 tsp tamarind paste, diluted in hot water and strained out the seeds
2 litres of Veg stock with 1 tbsp MSG
8 large potatoes peeled and chopped in good size chunks
instructions: Fry Onions in Veg oil until golden. Add garlic and ginger paste. Fry until just cooked (dont burn). Add dry spices and Masala Mix. Cook out the Masala, stirring continuously. Add chopped tomato and cook out properly till dark and rich. Add tomato paste and cook, stirring till nice and golden.
Cover with Veg stock, add potatoes and Chickpeas. 5 Minutes before finishing the curry, add the aubergines. Once its cooked, reserve in the fridge.

name: YORKIE MIX:
instructions: Mix all together with hand blander and pass trough chinois.
